gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ੳੁਲੂ ਅਾਦਿਤ ੳੁਦੋਤਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਕੳੁ ਨ ਜਾਨੇ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕੈ ਨ ਸੂਝੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗ ਮੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Uloo Aadit Udoti Joti Kau N Jaanay , Aan Dayv Sayvakai N Soojhai Saadhasang Mai ?
translation: Just as an owl cannot know the greatness of sunlight, similarly a worshipper of other deities cannot have perception of True Guru's advice and company of the holy men.

gurmukhi: ਮਰਕਟ ਮਨ ਮਾਨਿਕ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਨ ਜਾਨੇ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕ ਨ ਸਬਦੁ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਗ ਮੈ
transliteration: Marakat Man Maanik Mahimaa N Jaanay , Aan Dayv Sayvak N Sabadu Prasang Mai ?
translation: Just as a monkey does not know the value of pearls and diamonds, so can a follower of other deities not assess the importance of Guru's sermon.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਫਨਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਪੈ ਪਾਠ ਮਹਾਤਮੈ ਨ ਜਾਨੈ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕ ਮਹਾਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ਅੰਗ ਮੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Dhanindr Pai Paatth Mahaatamai N Jaanai , Aan Dayv Sayvak Mahaaprasaadi Ang Mai ?
translation: Just as a cobra cannot appreciate nectar-like milk, similarly a follower of other gods cannot understand significance of the blessings of the Guru's word and his consecrated gift of Karhah Parsad.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੁ ਹੰਸ ਬੰਸ ਬਗ ਠਗ ਨ ਸਕਤ ਟਿਕ ਅਗਮ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰ ਤਰੰਗ ਮੈ ॥੪੫੩॥
transliteration: Binu Hans Bans Bag Tthag N Sakat Tika , Agam Agaadhi Soukh Saagar Tarang Mai ?453?
translation: Just as an egret cannot fit in the flock of swans and has no knowledge of comforting waves of lake Mansarover. Similarly a worshipper (follower) of other gods cannot stay in the society of devout Sikhs blessed by the True Guru, nor can he understand the d
